etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Mineralogy Magazine. From rhombo- + -clase, after Hungarian rhomboklas

definitions: An iron sulphate mineral occurring as colourless or pale yellow, green, or blue tabular crystals, commonly as an oxidation product of pyrite.

notes.text: Rhomboclase is a hydrated acid sulphate of iron(iii), HFe(SO₄)₂·4H₂O. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
